intro: Catocoryne, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. The plant produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals, containing cardiac glycosides. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
